intro: Elettaria cardamomum zeylanicum, commonly known as cardamom, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is cultivated for its aromatic, greenish-black seed pods. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in terminal clusters. Its leaves are broad, lance-shaped, and have a smooth texture. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, fertile soil for optimal growth.
